lines.value: ecology has shown us that ecosystems exist in a state of dynamic equilibrium and can absorb only limited change by humans or any environmental actor
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: environmentalists contend that massive human economic activity has pushed the biosphere far from homeostasis through reduction of biodiversity and climate change
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: a consequence of this analysis is that the prevailing ideology of western civilisation is leading to mass extinction
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: this has prompted the need for new philosophical paradigms such as deep ecology which can guide human activity against perceived self destruction
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the phrase deep ecology was coined by the norwegian philosopher arne nass in 1972 and he helped give it a theoretical foundation
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: nass rejected the idea that beings can be ranked according to their relative value
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: for example judgements on whether an animal has an eternal soul whether it uses reason or whether it has consciousness have all been used to justify the ranking of the human animal over other animals
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: nass states that the right of all forms [of life] to live is a universal right which cannot be quantified
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: no single species of living being has more of this particular right to live and unfold than any other species this metaphysical idea is elucidated in warwick fox's claim that we and all other beings are aspects of a single unfolding reality
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecology finds scientific underpinnings in the fields of ecology and system dynamics
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: nass and fox do not use logic or induction to directly derive the philosophy from scientific ecology but rather claim that scientific ecology directly implies the metaphysics of deep ecology including its ideas about the self
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the scientific version of the gaia hypothesis was also an influence on the development of deep ecology
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the central spiritual tenet of deep ecology is that the human species is a part of the earth and not separate from it
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: a process of self realisation or re earthing is used for an individual to intuitively gain an ecocentric perspective
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the notion is based on the idea that the more we expand the self to identify with others people animals ecosystems the more we realise ourselves
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: transpersonal psychology has been used by warwick fox to support this idea
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: other traditions which have influenced deep ecology include taoism and zen buddhism primarily because they have a non dualistic approach to subject and object
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: in relation to the judeo christian tradition nass offers the following criticism the arrogance of stewardship [as found in the bible] consists in the idea of superiority which underlies the thought that we exist to watch over nature like a highly respected middleman between the creator and creation
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: drawing upon the buddhist tradition is the work of joanna macy
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: macy working as an anti nuclear activist in usa found that one of the major impediments confronting the activists cause was the presence of unresolved emotions of despair grief sorrow anger and rage
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the denial of these emotions led to apathy and disempowerment
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: we may have intellectual understanding of our interconnectedness but our culture experiential deep ecologists like john seed argue robs us of emotional and visceral experience of that interconnectedness which we had as small children but which has been socialised out of us by a highly anthropocentric alienating culture
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: through despair and empowerment work and more recently the work that reconnects macy and others have been taking experiential deep ecology into many countries including especially the usa europe particularly britain and germany russia and australia
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: proponents of deep ecology believe that the world does not exist as a resource to be freely exploited by humans
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the ethics of deep ecology holds that a whole system is morally superior to any of its parts
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: they offer an eight tier platform to elucidate their claims
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: in practice deep ecologists support decentralization the creation of ecoregions the breakdown of industrialism in its current form and an end to authoritarianism
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecology is not normally considered a distinct movement but as part of the green movement
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the deep ecological movement could be defined as those within the green movement who hold deep ecological views
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecologists welcome the labels gaian and green including the broader political implications of this term e.g commitment to peace
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecology has had a broad general influence on the green movement by providing an independent ethical platform for green parties political ecologists and environmentalists
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the philosophy of deep ecology helped differentiate the modern ecology movement by pointing out the anthropocentric bias of the term environment and rejecting the idea of humans as authoritarian guardians of the environment
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: some critics contend that deep ecology is misanthropic in that it advocates a reduction in human population
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecologists views on the natural role of epidemic disease and famine have been interpreted negatively to support this position
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecologists would defend themselves against charges of misanthropy by pointing out that population reduction can be achieved by lowering birth rates
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: they would also counter that scarcity increases value and excessively high populations decrease the value of the human individual
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: it should be added that a deep respect for nature includes a belief in the inherent worth of all beings that are a part of the natural world
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: only those humans who are alienated from the natural world and participate in its destruction are to be opposed
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the political philosophy of deep ecology has been criticised as ecofascism
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: in response deep ecologists claim that they advocate a new relationship between humanity and the ecosphere a relationship that seeks to end authoritarianism through decentralizaton and espouse a less dominating and aggressive posture towards nature a position that appears to be the opposite of fascism
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecology is criticised for the claim that the theory is deeper than other theories which by implication are shallow
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: it may be presumption to assert that one's thinking is deeper than others
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: both ecofeminism and deep ecology put forward a new conceptualization of the self
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: some ecofeminists such as marti kheel argue that self realization and identification with all nature places too much emphasis on the whole at the expense of the independent being
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: ecofeminists contend that their concept of the self as a dynamic process consisting of relations is superior
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: ecofeminists would also place more emphasis on the problem of androcentrism rather than anthropocentrism
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: daniel botkin has compared deep ecology unfavourably with its antithesis the wise use movement when he says that they both misunderstand scientific information and then arrive at conclusions based on their misunderstanding which are in turn used as justification for their ideologies
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: both begin with an ideology and are political and social in focus elsewhere though he asserts that deep ecology must be taken seriously in the debate about society and ecology as it challenges the fundamental assumptions of western philosophy
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: for something to require protection in itself it must have interests
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecology is criticised on the idea of the plant environment having its own interests
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecologists claim to identify with the environment and in doing so understand what the environment's interests are
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: these critics suggest that the interests that a deep ecologist gives to nature like growth individuality balance and fairness are really human interests
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: the earth is endowed with wisdom wilderness equates with freedom and life forms are said to emit moral qualities
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: social ecologists such as murray bookchin claim that deep ecology fails to link environmental crises with authoritarianism and hierarchy
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: social ecologists believe that environmental problems are firmly rooted in the manner of human social interaction and protest that an ecologically sustainable society could still be socially exploitative
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)

lines.value: deep ecologists reject the argument that ecological behavior is rooted in the social paradigm according to their view that is an anthropocentric fallacy and they maintain that the converse of the social ecologists objection is also true in that it is equally possible for a socially egalitarian society to continue to exploit the earth
lines.name: Norwegian (Nynorsk)
